alert.note: Alert for Charlotte (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 30 at 2:52AM EDT until August 31 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Tampa Bay
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central, south central, southwest, and west central Florida, including the following counties, in central Florida, Hardee and Polk. In south central Florida, DeSoto and Highlands. In southwest Florida, Charlotte and Lee. In west central Florida, Hillsborough, Manatee and Sarasota. * WHEN...Until 600 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 252 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cape Coral, Fort Myers, North Port, Sarasota, Bradenton, Bartow, Punta Gorda, Lake Wales, Palmetto, Avon Park, Arcadia, Wauchula, Port Charlotte, Anna Maria, Southeast Arcadia, Myakka City, Charlotte County Airport, Myakka River State Park, Babcock Ranch and Babcock Webb Wma. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
